greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts 4k and 4k+2 with at least one part of each type.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000 (first 101 terms from Robert Price)
mathematica: nmax = 70; s1 = Range[1, nmax/4]*4; s2 = Range[0, nmax/4]*4 + 2;
x_ /; ContainsAny[x, s1 ] && ContainsAny[x, s2 ]], {n, 0, nmax}] (* _Robert Price_, Aug 06 2020 *)
nmax = 70; l = Rest@CoefficientList[Series[(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(4 k)), {k, 1, nmax}])*(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(4 k + 2)), {k, 0, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x]  (* _Robert Price_, Aug 16 2020*)
xref: Bisections give: A006477 (even part), A000004 (odd part).
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
